001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
010import java.util.Objects;
011
012public class Quaternion {
013  private final double m_r;
014  private final Vector<N3> m_v;
015
016  /** Constructs a quaternion with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
017  public Quaternion() {
018    m_r = 1.0;
019    m_v = VecBuilder.fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
020  }
021
022  /**
023   * Constructs a quaternion with the given components.
024   *
025   * @param w W component of the quaternion.
026   * @param x X component of the quaternion.
027   * @param y Y component of the quaternion.
028   * @param z Z component of the quaternion.
029   */
030  public Quaternion(double w, double x, double y, double z) {
031    m_r = w;
032    m_v = VecBuilder.fill(x, y, z);
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Multiply with another quaternion.
037   *
038   * @param other The other quaternion.
039   * @return The quaternion product.
040   */
041  public Quaternion times(Quaternion other) {
042    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quaternion#Scalar_and_vector_parts
043    final var r1 = m_r;
044    final var v1 = m_v;
045    final var r2 = other.m_r;
046    final var v2 = other.m_v;
047
048    // v₁ x v₂
049    var cross =
050        VecBuilder.fill(
051            v1.get(1, 0) * v2.get(2, 0) - v2.get(1, 0) * v1.get(2, 0),
052            v2.get(0, 0) * v1.get(2, 0) - v1.get(0, 0) * v2.get(2, 0),
053            v1.get(0, 0) * v2.get(1, 0) - v2.get(0, 0) * v1.get(1, 0));
054
055    // v = r₁v₂ + r₂v₁ + v₁ x v₂
056    final var v = v2.times(r1).plus(v1.times(r2)).plus(cross);
057
058    return new Quaternion(r1 * r2 - v1.dot(v2), v.get(0, 0), v.get(1, 0), v.get(2, 0));
059  }
060
061  @Override
062  public String toString() {
063    return String.format(
064        "Quaternion(%s, %s, %s, %s)", m_r, m_v.get(0, 0), m_v.get(1, 0), m_v.get(2, 0));
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Checks equality between this Quaternion and another object.
069   *
070   * @param obj The other object.
071   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
072   */
073  @Override
074  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
075    if (obj instanceof Quaternion) {
076      var other = (Quaternion) obj;
077
078      return Math.abs(m_r * other.m_r + m_v.dot(other.m_v)) > 1.0 - 1E-9;
079    }
080    return false;
081  }
082
083  @Override
084  public int hashCode() {
085    return Objects.hash(m_r, m_v);
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Returns the inverse of the quaternion.
090   *
091   * @return The inverse quaternion.
092   */
093  public Quaternion inverse() {
094    return new Quaternion(m_r, -m_v.get(0, 0), -m_v.get(1, 0), -m_v.get(2, 0));
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Normalizes the quaternion.
099   *
100   * @return The normalized quaternion.
101   */
102  public Quaternion normalize() {
103    double norm = Math.sqrt(getW() * getW() + getX() * getX() + getY() * getY() + getZ() * getZ());
104    if (norm == 0.0) {
105      return new Quaternion();
106    } else {
107      return new Quaternion(getW() / norm, getX() / norm, getY() / norm, getZ() / norm);
108    }
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Returns W component of the quaternion.
113   *
114   * @return W component of the quaternion.
115   */
116  public double getW() {
117    return m_r;
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Returns X component of the quaternion.
122   *
123   * @return X component of the quaternion.
124   */
125  public double getX() {
126    return m_v.get(0, 0);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Returns Y component of the quaternion.
131   *
132   * @return Y component of the quaternion.
133   */
134  public double getY() {
135    return m_v.get(1, 0);
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Returns Z component of the quaternion.
140   *
141   * @return Z component of the quaternion.
142   */
143  public double getZ() {
144    return m_v.get(2, 0);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Returns the rotation vector representation of this quaternion.
149   *
150   * <p>This is also the log operator of SO(3).
151   *
152   * @return The rotation vector representation of this quaternion.
153   */
154  public Vector<N3> toRotationVector() {
155    // See equation (31) in "Integrating Generic Sensor Fusion Algorithms with
156    // Sound State Representation through Encapsulation of Manifolds"
157    //
158    // https://arxiv.org/pdf/1107.1119.pdf
159    double norm = m_v.norm();
160
161    if (norm < 1e-9) {
162      return m_v.times(2.0 / getW() - 2.0 / 3.0 * norm * norm / (getW() * getW() * getW()));
163    } else {
164      if (getW() < 0.0) {
165        return m_v.times(2.0 * Math.atan2(-norm, -getW()) / norm);
166      } else {
167        return m_v.times(2.0 * Math.atan2(norm, getW()) / norm);
168      }
169    }
170  }
171}
